name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
description: A digestive disorder in which stomach acid or bile flows back into the food pipe (esophagus), irritating its lining.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
Feeling of a lump in the throat
causes: GERD is most often caused by a weakened lower esophageal sphincter, allowing stomach acid to flow back into the esophagus. It may also be triggered by obesity, hiatal hernia, pregnancy, or delayed stomach emptying.
prevention_tips: Avoid spicy, fatty, and acidic foods
Do not lie down immediately after eating
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if symptoms occur frequently, interfere with daily life, or if you experience difficulty swallowing, unexplained weight loss, vomiting blood, or severe chest pain.

name: Acne
description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, leading to pimples and inflammation.
causes: Acne develops when excess oil, dead skin cells, and bacteria clog hair follicles. Hormonal changes, stress, and certain medications can worsen this process.
risk_factors: Touching or rubbing the skin frequently
when_to_seek_help: Consult a dermatologist if acne is severe, painful, leaves scars, or does not improve with over-the-counter treatments.

name: Allergic Rhinitis
description: An allergic reaction that causes sneezing, congestion, runny nose, and itchy eyes due to airborne allergens.
causes: Allergic rhinitis occurs when the immune system overreacts to allergens such as pollen, dust mites, mold, or pet dander.
prevention_tips: Keep windows closed during pollen season
Wash hands and face after outdoor exposure
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if symptoms persist, disturb sleep, or cause breathing problems or frequent sinus infections.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive neurological disorder that gradually destroys memory, thinking skills, and the ability to carry out daily activities.
causes: Alzheimer’s disease is caused by abnormal buildup of proteins in the brain that damage and destroy nerve cells, disrupting communication between them.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if memory loss, confusion, or personality changes begin interfering with daily activities or safety.

name: Anemia
description: A condition in which the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to tissues.
causes: Anemia is commonly caused by iron deficiency, vitamin deficiencies, blood loss, or chronic diseases that reduce red blood cell production.
prevention_tips: Consume vitamin C for iron absorption
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if you experience severe fatigue, chest pain, shortness of breath, or fainting.

name: Anxiety Disorder
description: A mental health condition characterized by excessive fear, worry, and nervousness that interferes with daily activities.
causes: Anxiety disorders develop due to a combination of genetic predisposition, brain chemistry imbalance, stressful life events, and environmental factors.
when_to_seek_help: Seek professional help if anxiety interferes with work, relationships, sleep, or causes panic attacks or thoughts of self-harm.

name: Arthritis
description: A condition characterized by inflammation of one or more joints, leading to pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
causes: Arthritis is caused by joint inflammation resulting from cartilage wear, autoimmune disorders, or infections that damage joint tissues.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if joint pain, swelling, or stiffness persists, worsens, or limits your ability to perform daily activities.

name: Asthma
description: A chronic lung disease that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways, making breathing difficult.
causes: Asthma is caused by airway inflammation triggered by allergens, infections, exercise, cold air, or pollutants.
when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if breathing becomes extremely difficult, lips turn blue, or inhalers do not provide relief.

name: Back Pain
description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back, often caused by muscle strain or spine issues.
causes: Back pain is commonly caused by muscle strain, poor posture, herniated discs, or spinal degeneration.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if pain lasts more than a few weeks, worsens, or is accompanied by numbness or weakness.

name: Bronchitis
description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to and from the lungs.
causes: Bronchitis is caused by viral or bacterial infections or prolonged exposure to irritants like smoke.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical help if cough lasts more than three weeks, or if fever and breathing difficulty occur.

name: COPD
description: A progressive lung disease that blocks airflow and makes breathing difficult.
causes: COPD is mainly caused by long-term exposure to tobacco smoke and air pollutants.
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if breathing becomes very difficult, lips turn blue, or symptoms suddenly worsen.

name: Cardiac Arrest
description: A sudden loss of heart function that stops blood flow to the brain and body.
causes: Cardiac arrest is caused by an electrical malfunction in the heart that disrupts normal heart rhythm.
when_to_seek_help: This is a medical emergency. Call emergency services immediately if someone collapses, has no pulse, or stops breathing.

name: Cataracts
description: A condition in which the normally clear lens of the eye becomes cloudy, leading to vision impairment.
causes: Cataracts develop due to aging, eye injury, or prolonged exposure to ultraviolet light that causes proteins in the lens to clump together.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if vision becomes blurry, night vision worsens, or glare interferes with daily activities.

name: Cervical Cancer
description: A type of cancer that develops in the cells of the cervix, most commonly caused by HPV infection.
causes: Cervical cancer is caused by persistent infection with high-risk types of human papillomavirus (HPV), which leads to abnormal cell growth.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if you have unexplained vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, or abnormal discharge.

name: Chickenpox
description: A contagious viral infection that causes an itchy, blister-like rash and flu-like symptoms.
causes: Chickenpox is caused by the varicella-zoster virus, which spreads through coughing, sneezing, or direct contact with blisters.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if fever is high, rash spreads to eyes, or signs of infection appear.

name: Cholera
description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by consuming food or water contaminated with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
causes: Cholera is caused by drinking contaminated water or eating food infected with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if severe diarrhea, dehydration, or weakness develops.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: A long-term condition in which the kidneys gradually lose their ability to filter waste from the blood.
causes: Chronic kidney disease is commonly caused by diabetes, high blood pressure, and long-term kidney damage.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if swelling, fatigue, or changes in urination persist.

name: Colorectal Cancer
description: Cancer that affects the colon or rectum, often starting as abnormal growths called polyps.
causes: Colorectal cancer develops when abnormal cells in the colon or rectum grow uncontrollably, often from polyps.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if you notice blood in stool, persistent bowel changes, or unexplained weight loss.

name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
description: An inflammation of the transparent membrane that lines the eyelid and eyeball, causing redness and irritation.
symptoms: Redness in one or both eyes
causes: Conjunctivitis is caused by viral or bacterial infections, allergic reactions, or exposure to irritants such as smoke or chemicals.
prevention_tips: Do not share towels or makeup
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if eye pain, vision loss, severe redness, or thick discharge develops.

name: Constipation
description: A condition in which bowel movements become infrequent or difficult to pass.
symptoms: Less than three bowel movements per week
causes: Constipation is caused by slow movement of stool through the digestive tract due to low fiber intake, dehydration, or lack of physical activity.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if constipation lasts more than two weeks, or is accompanied by blood, severe pain, or weight loss.

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: A condition in which the coronary arteries become narrowed or blocked, reducing blood flow to the heart.
causes: Coronary artery disease is caused by the buildup of plaque in the arteries, which restricts blood flow to the heart muscle.
when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if chest pain is severe, lasts more than a few minutes, or is accompanied by shortness of breath or fainting.

name: Dengue Fever
description: A mosquito-borne viral infection that causes high fever, body pain, and flu-like symptoms.
causes: Dengue fever is caused by the dengue virus, which is transmitted through the bite of infected mosquitoes.
prevention_tips: Avoid outdoor exposure at dawn and dusk
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if there is severe abdominal pain, bleeding, persistent vomiting, or extreme fatigue.

name: Depression
description: A mental health disorder characterized by persistent sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in activities.
causes: Depression develops due to imbalances in brain chemicals combined with genetic, emotional, and environmental factors.
when_to_seek_help: Get immediate help if you have thoughts of self-harm, hopelessness, or inability to function normally.

name: Eczema
description: A chronic skin condition that causes dry, itchy, and inflamed patches of skin.
causes: Eczema is caused by an overactive immune response and a weakened skin barrier that allows moisture loss and irritation.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if eczema becomes painful, infected, or interferes with sleep or daily life.

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent, unprovoked seizures due to abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
causes: Epilepsy can result from brain injury, genetic factors, infections, stroke, or abnormal brain development.
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if seizures last longer than five minutes, occur repeatedly, or are followed by difficulty breathing.

name: Fibromyalgia
description: A chronic disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue and sleep problems.
causes: Fibromyalgia is thought to be caused by abnormal pain processing in the brain and nervous system.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if pain and fatigue persist and interfere with daily activities.

name: Food Poisoning
description: An illness caused by consuming food contaminated with bacteria, viruses, or parasites.
causes: Food poisoning is caused by eating food contaminated with harmful microorganisms or toxins.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if severe vomiting, dehydration, bloody stools, or high fever occurs.

name: Gastritis
description: Inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause pain and digestive discomfort.
causes: Gastritis is caused by infection with H. pylori bacteria, excessive alcohol use, or long-term use of painkillers.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if stomach pain, vomiting blood, or black stools occur.

name: Glaucoma
description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.
causes: Glaucoma is caused by increased pressure inside the eye that damages the optic nerve.
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if you experience sudden vision loss, eye pain, or severe headache.

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis caused by high uric acid levels that lead to joint inflammation.
causes: Gout occurs when uric acid crystals build up in joints due to excess uric acid in the blood.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if joint pain is severe, sudden, or accompanied by fever.

name: HIV/AIDS
description: A viral infection that attacks the immune system, reducing the body’s ability to fight infections and disease.
causes: HIV is caused by the human immunodeficiency virus, which spreads through blood, sexual contact, or from mother to child.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if exposed to HIV, or if persistent fever, weight loss, or recurrent infections occur.

name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
description: A life-threatening condition that occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked.
symptoms: Pain in arms, neck, or jaw
causes: Heart attack occurs when plaque buildup in coronary arteries ruptures, blocking blood flow to heart muscle.
when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if you experience chest pain, shortness of breath, or fainting.

name: Heart Failure
description: A chronic condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet the body’s needs.
causes: Heart failure develops when the heart muscle is weakened or damaged by heart disease or high blood pressure.
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if you experience sudden weight gain, severe shortness of breath, or chest pain.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease.
causes: Hepatitis B is caused by a virus transmitted through blood, sexual contact, or from mother to baby.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if jaundice, dark urine, or abdominal pain occurs.

name: Hypertension
description: A condition in which the force of blood against artery walls is consistently too high.
causes: Hypertension is caused by genetic factors, poor diet, lack of exercise, and stress.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if blood pressure readings are consistently high or symptoms like chest pain occur.

name: Insomnia
description: A sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall or stay asleep.
causes: Insomnia is caused by stress, anxiety, poor sleep habits, or medical conditions.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical advice if sleeplessness lasts more than a few weeks or affects daily functioning.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
description: A chronic disorder affecting the large intestine, causing abdominal pain and changes in bowel habits.
causes: IBS is caused by abnormal gut-brain communication, intestinal muscle contractions, and increased sensitivity of the digestive tract.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if symptoms are severe, persistent, or accompanied by weight loss or bleeding.

name: Jaundice
description: A condition in which the skin and eyes turn yellow due to high bilirubin levels in the blood.
causes: Jaundice occurs when the liver cannot process bilirubin properly due to liver disease, infection, or bile duct blockage.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if yellowing of the skin or eyes appears, especially with abdominal pain or fever.

name: Kidney Cancer
description: A type of cancer that begins in the cells of the kidneys.
causes: Kidney cancer develops when abnormal kidney cells grow uncontrollably and form a tumor.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if blood in urine, persistent pain, or unexplained weight loss occurs.

name: Leukemia
description: A cancer of blood-forming tissues that interferes with the body’s ability to fight infection.
causes: Leukemia occurs when bone marrow produces abnormal white blood cells that crowd out healthy cells.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if persistent fatigue, frequent infections, or unexplained bruising occurs.

name: Liver Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the liver, often linked to chronic liver disease.
causes: Liver cancer is caused by chronic liver inflammation due to hepatitis, alcohol abuse, or fatty liver disease.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical help if abdominal swelling, yellowing of skin, or unexplained weight loss occurs.

name: Lung Cancer
description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs and interferes with normal breathing.
causes: Lung cancer is mainly caused by smoking and long-term exposure to air pollutants and toxic substances.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if cough, chest pain, or breathlessness persists or worsens.

name: Lymphoma
description: A cancer of the lymphatic system that affects immune cells called lymphocytes.
causes: Lymphoma occurs when lymphocytes grow uncontrollably due to genetic mutations or immune system dysfunction.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if swollen lymph nodes do not go away or are accompanied by fever and weight loss.

name: Malaria
description: A life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted through mosquito bites.
causes: Malaria is caused by Plasmodium parasites transmitted through infected mosquito bites.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if fever, chills, or flu-like symptoms appear after mosquito exposure.

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition that causes intense, recurring headaches and sensory disturbances.
causes: Migraines occur due to changes in brain chemicals and nerve pathways, often triggered by stress, hormones, or certain foods.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if headaches are frequent, severe, or accompanied by neurological symptoms.

name: Obesity
description: A condition involving excessive body fat that increases the risk of serious health problems.
causes: Obesity is caused by consuming more calories than the body uses, often combined with lack of physical activity.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical advice if weight gain affects breathing, mobility, or overall health.

name: Oral Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the mouth, tongue, gums, or throat.
causes: Oral cancer is caused mainly by tobacco use, alcohol consumption, and HPV infection.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor or dentist if mouth sores or patches do not heal within two weeks.

name: Osteoporosis
description: A condition that causes bones to become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures.
causes: Osteoporosis occurs when bone density decreases due to aging, hormonal changes, or lack of calcium and vitamin D.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical evaluation if fractures occur easily or posture changes suddenly.

name: Ovarian Cancer
description: A type of cancer that begins in the ovaries and often goes undetected until it has spread.
causes: Ovarian cancer develops when abnormal ovarian cells grow uncontrollably, often due to genetic mutations or hormonal factors.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if bloating, pelvic pain, or changes in appetite persist for more than two weeks.

name: Parkinson’s Disease
description: A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement and coordination.
causes: Parkinson’s disease is caused by the loss of dopamine-producing brain cells.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if tremors, stiffness, or balance problems appear.

name: Peptic Ulcer
description: Open sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach or small intestine.
causes: Peptic ulcers are caused by infection with H. pylori bacteria or long-term use of pain-relieving medications.
when_to_seek_help: Seek urgent care if you have severe pain, vomiting blood, or black stools.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.
causes: Pneumonia is caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi infecting the lungs.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if breathing becomes difficult, fever is high, or chest pain occurs.

name: Prostate Cancer
description: A type of cancer that develops in the prostate gland in men.
causes: Prostate cancer develops when abnormal cells grow uncontrollably in the prostate gland.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if urination problems, blood in urine, or pelvic pain occurs.

name: Psoriasis
description: A chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid buildup of skin cells.
causes: Psoriasis occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks healthy skin cells.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a dermatologist if skin becomes painful, widespread, or affects daily life.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: An autoimmune disorder that causes chronic inflammation of joints and other body systems.
causes: Rheumatoid arthritis occurs when the immune system attacks the lining of the joints, causing inflammation and damage.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if joint pain and stiffness persist or worsen and limit daily activities.

name: Sciatica
description: Pain that radiates along the path of the sciatic nerve from the lower back down the legs.
causes: Sciatica occurs when the sciatic nerve is compressed due to a herniated disc or spinal narrowing.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if pain is severe, persistent, or accompanied by weakness or loss of bladder control.

name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
description: A dangerous form of skin cancer that develops from pigment-producing cells.
causes: Melanoma is caused by DNA damage from ultraviolet radiation exposure.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if a mole changes in size, shape, or color or begins bleeding.

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation of the sinuses that causes congestion and facial pain.
causes: Sinusitis is caused by infection, allergies, or blocked sinus passages.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if symptoms last longer than 10 days or are severe.

name: Stomach Cancer
description: Cancer that develops in the lining of the stomach.
causes: Stomach cancer is caused by chronic inflammation, H. pylori infection, and unhealthy diet.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if stomach pain, vomiting blood, or unexplained weight loss occurs.

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency caused by interrupted blood supply to the brain.
causes: Stroke occurs when a blood vessel to the brain is blocked or ruptures.
when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if any stroke symptoms appear.

name: Thyroid Disorders
description: Conditions that affect the thyroid gland, disrupting hormone balance.
causes: Thyroid disorders result from autoimmune disease, iodine deficiency, or hormonal imbalance.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if unexplained weight or mood changes occur.

name: Tuberculosis
description: A serious bacterial infection that mainly affects the lungs.
causes: Tuberculosis is caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis spread through airborne droplets.
when_to_seek_help: Consult a doctor if cough lasts longer than three weeks or blood appears in sputum.

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection that spreads through contaminated food or water.
causes: Typhoid fever is caused by Salmonella typhi bacteria.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if fever lasts more than three days or abdominal pain worsens.

name: Urinary Tract Infection
description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.
causes: UTIs occur when bacteria enter the urinary tract and multiply.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if pain, fever, or blood in urine occurs.

name: Varicose Veins
description: Enlarged, twisted veins that usually appear in the legs.
causes: Varicose veins occur when vein valves fail, causing blood to pool.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if veins become painful, swollen, or bleed.

name: Vertigo
description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness caused by inner ear or brain problems.
causes: Vertigo is caused by inner ear disorders, head injury, or nerve problems.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical attention if dizziness is severe, persistent, or accompanied by vision or speech problems.

name: Vision Impairment
description: Partial or complete loss of eyesight that affects daily activities.
causes: Vision impairment results from eye diseases, injury, or aging-related degeneration.
when_to_seek_help: Consult an eye doctor if vision suddenly worsens or pain develops.

name: Vitamin D Deficiency
description: A condition in which the body does not have enough vitamin D to maintain bone and immune health.
causes: Vitamin D deficiency occurs due to limited sunlight exposure, poor diet, or absorption problems.
when_to_seek_help: See a doctor if bone pain, weakness, or frequent illness occurs.

name: Whooping Cough
description: A highly contagious bacterial respiratory infection.
causes: Whooping cough is caused by Bordetella pertussis bacteria.
when_to_seek_help: Seek medical care if coughing fits cause breathing difficulty or vomiting.

name: Yellow Fever
description: A viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes that can cause severe illness.
causes: Yellow fever is caused by a virus transmitted by infected mosquitoes.
prevention_tips: Stay indoors at peak mosquito times
when_to_seek_help: Seek emergency care if fever with yellowing of eyes or bleeding occurs.
